clinical_study.official_title: Efficacy and Safety of Dexmedetomidine Combined With Butorphanol Tartrate for Postoperative Analgesia and Breastfeeding in Cesarean Section

lead_sponsor.agency: The First Affiliated Hospital with Nanjing Medical University

clinical_study.source: The First Affiliated Hospital with Nanjing Medical University

brief_summary.textblock: Nervous, anxiety, fear and other psychological reactions always appears in parturients during cesarean section. This study intends to investigate the effectiveness and safety of dexmedetomidine combined with butorphanol tartrate for postoperative analgesia and breastfeeding after caesarean section.

study_design_info.masking: Quadruple (Participant, Care Provider, Investigator, Outcomes Assessor)

primary_outcome.measure: Postoperative Pain Score (Visual Analogue Scale, VAS) at Rest
primary_outcome.description: visual analogue scale (VAS; with 0, no pain; to 10, the worst imaginable pain) is a validated assessing scale for pain intensity. VAS at rest was assessed when the patient was in supine position

secondary_outcome.description: Relative infant dose (RID) =Dose (infant, mg•kg-1•day-1) /Dose (mother, mg•kg-1•day-1) μg·kg-1·h-1. The Dose (infant) in mg•kg-1 is calculated by multiplying the concentration of the drug in breast milk by the volume of breast milk consumed daily (about 150 mL•kg-1).

secondary_outcome.measure: Postoperative Pain Score (Visual Analogue Scale, VAS) at Rest
secondary_outcome.description: visual analogue scale (VAS; with 0, no pain; to 10, the worst imaginable pain) is a validated assessing scale for pain intensity. VAS at rest was assessed when the patient was in supine position

Sedation intensity measured with RSS is recorded at the 6, 12 24 and 48 h after cesarean section. Sedation was assessed by the Ramsay Sedation Scores (RSS) (1, anxious patient; 2, cooperative and tranquil; 3, responding to command; 4, brisk response to stimulus; 5, sluggish response to stimulus; 6, no response to stimulus).

The degree of satisfaction (0, very satisfied; 1, satisfied; 2, moderately satisfied; 3, not satisfied) was evaluated at 48 h after surgery. The number of overall satisfied patients (satisfied and very satisfied) is reported.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants That Experienced Nausea or Vomiting

arm_group.description: The placebo group will pumped in the same volume of saline 0.9% as calculated by parturients' weight in 30 min and receive 1mg butorphanol after delivery. Postoperative analgesic formula: 3ug/kg/h butorphanol tartrate, diluted with normal saline to 100ml. Background dose: 2ml/h, PCA: 0.5ml, locking time: 15 min.

This group will receive 0.5ug/kg intravenous dexmedetomidine diluted to 4ug/ml in 30 min and 1mg butorphanol tartrate after delivery. Postoperative analgesic formula: 3ug/kg/h butorphanol tartrate with 0.03ug/kg/h dexmedetomidine, diluted with normal saline to 100ml. Background dose: 2ml/h, PCA: 0.5ml, locking time: 15 min.

This group will receive 0.5ug/kg intravenous dexmedetomidine diluted to 4ug/ml in 30 min and 1mg butorphanol tartrate after delivery. Postoperative analgesic formula: 3ug/kg/h butorphanol tartrate with 0.05ug/kg/h dexmedetomidine, diluted with normal saline to 100ml. Background dose: 2ml/h, PCA: 0.5ml, locking time: 15 min.

This group will receive 0.5ug/kg intravenous dexmedetomidine diluted to 4ug/ml in 30 min and 1mg butorphanol tartrate after delivery. Postoperative analgesic formula: 3ug/kg/h butorphanol tartrate with 0.08ug/kg/h dexmedetomidine, diluted with normal saline to 100ml. Background dose: 2ml/h, PCA: 0.5ml, locking time: 15 min.

Drug: Dexmedetomidine This group receive Dex 0.5ug/kg after delivery. Drug: butorphanol tartrate and Dexmedetomidine. PCA: butorphanol tartrate with 0.05ug/kg/h Dexmedetomidine after cesarean section.

Drug: Dexmedetomidine This group receive Dex 0.5ug/kg after delivery. Drug: butorphanol tartrate and Dexmedetomidine. PCA: butorphanol tartrate with 0.08ug/kg/h Dexmedetomidine after cesarean section.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
1. Parturients who had successfully breastfed a prior infant and planned to breastfeed after this delivery were screened for eligibility.
2. Parturients undergoing elective caesarean delivery under epidural anaesthesia
3. ASA I and II parturients aged 18-45 years, with singleton gestation.
4. Parturients with verbal and written mandarin
5. Parturients who want to use PCA intravenous analgesia and can use the pump correctly
6. written informed consent.
Exclusion Criteria
1. Multiple gestation.
2. A history of allergy to dexmedetomidine or other study drugs
3. Cardiovascular disease (basic HR<50bpm or SBP<100mmHg)
4. Opioid drugs abuse.
5. BMI more than 35 kg/m2
6. Conditions that preclude spinal anesthesia.
7. Preeclampsia or epilepsy.
8. A history of neuromuscular disease.
9. Epidural anaesthesia was unsuccessful.
10. The parturients, whose surgery ended after 11 a.m.

analysis.groups_desc: The sample size was calculated on the basis of an our initial pilot study, and the SD was 1.4 between the four groups. We hypothesized that the differences in VAS between the four groups and the SDs would be 15%. A power analysis suggested that there will be 80% power to detect differences at an α=0.05 significance level (two-tailed), including 24 individuals per treatment group. Considering the exclusion of 25% of patients, 30 parturients were eventually recruited in each group.

outcome.title: Relative Infant Dose (RID) of Dexmedetomidine
outcome.description: Relative infant dose (RID) =Dose (infant, mg•kg-1•day-1) /Dose (mother, mg•kg-1•day-1) μg·kg-1·h-1. The Dose (infant) in mg•kg-1 is calculated by multiplying the concentration of the drug in breast milk by the volume of breast milk consumed daily (about 150 mL•kg-1).

measure.description: Relative infant dose (RID) =Dose (infant, mg•kg-1•day-1) /Dose (mother, mg•kg-1•day-1) μg·kg-1·h-1. The Dose (infant) in mg•kg-1 is calculated by multiplying the concentration of the drug in breast milk by the volume of breast milk consumed daily (about 150 mL•kg-1).
